content.question:
The critic rating and audience score for 8 movies are shown in the table.

Critic Rating 
72 
80 
65 
23 
28 
60 
41 
35 

Audience Score 
64 
92 
90 
48 
55 
70 
44 
80 

An owner of a movie theater is investigating whether critic rating can be used to predict the mean audience score of movies. Assuming the conditions for inference have been met, which of the following inference procedures is the most appropriate to estimate the mean change in audience score for each 1 point increase in the critic rating?

choices.label: A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for means
A linear regression <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for slope
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between means
A matched-pairs <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a mean difference
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between proportions

content.answer: A linear regression <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for slope

topic.text: 9.2: Confidence Intervals for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate inference method for confidence intervals.
